{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3397651,"name":"Brandon Rindfleisch","username":"MrBeef8531","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbeef8531/{size}/152793_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T15:54:28.839Z","cooked":"

Hey CD hive mind!

We really haven’t done much with CAD in our few years of existence (other than some basic stuff to help us hammer out some spacing) and we really want to make a concerted effort to get going this year with using CAD to actually, ya know, aid our design. . The students at our school have Windows laptops, and I’ve heard from soooo many teams to use OnShape because it’s cloud-based, free, etc. This all sounds good to me, the non-engineer high school science teacher mentor. However, from my engineer mentors I’m hearing that OnShape works so differently than other CAD programs that if students learn OnShape, they’d essentially have to re-learn it eventually if they end up working with CAD professionally. So, I’m wondering if something like Fusion 360 might actually be the better bet if I’m starting fresh. I may be able to land a desktop or two that have better graphics capabilities for other programs, but that’s only two PCs. What do you think?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T15:54:28.839Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":71,"reads":425,"readers_count":424,"score":445.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"Brandon Rindfleisch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/resons-for-my-team-why-to-stay-with-solidworks/468287/25","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Resons for my team why to stay with solidworks","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48222,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3397671,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T16:26:20.415Z","cooked":"
MrBeef8531:

However, from my engineer mentors I’m hearing that OnShape works so differently than other CAD programs that if students learn OnShape, they’d essentially have to re-learn it eventually if they end up working with CAD professionally.

Grew up using Solidworks, and I disagree with this. It also really isn’t something you should be worrying about. Onshape is easily available, easy for kids to use on most laptops/desktops, and is currently one of the easiest CAD programs to use remotely/collaboratively.

If you don’t already use much CAD, Onshape is a huge step forward for your team. They also have a ton of great tutorials, tons of resources that are FRC specific, and a lot of publicly available CAD for your students to learn from.

Edit - the link below is a resource created by 6328.

Onshape4FRC

Home

Onshape CAD and Design resources to help teach for FRC.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T18:10:23.480Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":386,"readers_count":385,"score":227.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://onshape4frc.com/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Home | Onshape4FRC","clicks":23}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/2","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397679,"name":"Matt","username":"Matt930","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/matt930/{size}/226360_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T16:44:43.366Z","cooked":"

The biggest difference between Onshape and most other CAD software is that Onshape uses one document, comprised of part studios, which can hold multiple parts, and assemblies. Most other CAD programs use individual part files, which hold a single part, and part assembly files.

In my experience, designing parts in Onshape is very similar to Solidworks, creo, fusion, etc, so I disagree that people would need to relearn CAD in order to use other softwares, although the organization style will definitely be different than Onshape.

Of all of the CAD software I’ve used, Onshape is the clear best (IMO) due to its collaboration capabilities, which it does better than any other CAD software I’ve used.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T16:49:54.720Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":328,"readers_count":327,"score":200.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"Matt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54677,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397684,"name":"Rufus Mainwaring","username":"Rufus_t_Doofus","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rufus_t_doofus/{size}/179852_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T17:05:32.203Z","cooked":"

I learned to use onshape in highschool for FRC and just learned to use solideworks in college. The jump has been quite seemless and I was to find my usual part design tools quite quickly. The least seemless new technique was probably the mate system. It’s different, but it wasn’t difficult to learn whatsoever. It just wasn’t quite automatic. All that to say, I don’t think your students will have much if any difficulty translating their skills. (oh, and solidwors has set mouse settings which i find annoying)

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T17:05:32.203Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":294,"readers_count":293,"score":188.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"Rufus Mainwaring","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53720,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"847 Alumnus/Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/4","custom_user_title":"847 Alumnus/Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397698,"name":"Kevin LaPerriere","username":"kl26436","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/ea5d25/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T17:29:32.729Z","cooked":"
Matt930:

In my experience, designing parts in Onshape is very similar to Solidworks, creo, fusion, etc, so I disagree that people would need to relearn CAD in order to use other softwares, although the organization style will definitely be different than Onshape.

I’m also going to agree here. OnShape felt very similar to Solidworks and the few times I’ve used --it’s been very easy.

The other thing is that kids who go into design engineering are just going to need to get comfortable with different software packages over their careers just like programmers need to be comfortable with multiple languages. I’ve worked with Solidworks, NX, and Catia at different companies professionally and Fusion for FRC; so learning OnShape in high school and then maybe learning Creo or Solidworks in college is just going to help them being comfortable adapting to new tools.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T17:30:02.099Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":270,"readers_count":269,"score":129.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"Kevin LaPerriere","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37084,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397705,"name":"Brandon Rindfleisch","username":"MrBeef8531","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbeef8531/{size}/152793_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T17:38:38.624Z","cooked":"

Thanks everybody!

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T17:38:38.624Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":233,"readers_count":232,"score":61.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"Brandon Rindfleisch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48222,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397720,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T18:31:44.987Z","cooked":"

Onshape is good.

Fundamentally if you are teaching CAD to develop design skills you are teaching a design workflow, not a software.

Some CAD software has better implementation of tools/feature scripts for various tasks other software is stronger for other design accelerators/ workflows. But at the end of the day this is all roughly analogous to learning to code. Once you get one set of skills down the next language is really just syntax and a small bag of tricks.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T18:33:04.884Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":102.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/7","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397742,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T19:26:16.095Z","cooked":"

I’d avoid Fusion360 as a CAD software, we use it for CAM which it’s pretty good for, but I think if is significantly worse for transferable skills than Onshape, I particularly hate it’s mates. I really wish Autodesk would devote the resources to improve Inventor which just feels hopelessly outdated and unmaintained now.

Personally I like SolidWorks specifically because it is not reliant on a network connection, and I can use it freely when traveling or at events with poor internet. I’m also not aware of any companies in my area that use Onshape so there is at least a small transition for professional CAD work. My understanding is the skills transfer from Onshape to other softwares quite well, but you still don’t have the exact skill an employer is looking for and recruiters won’t have any idea how hard the transition is.

That said, for teams where students don’t reliably have good windows computers, but do have reliable internet (most teams probably) Onshape seems like the obvious choice.

Note that basically all CAD softwares are free to FIRST teams, you just might have to ask.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T19:26:16.095Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":181,"readers_count":180,"score":71.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/8","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397752,"name":"wesbass23","username":"wesbass23","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T19:34:58.448Z","cooked":"

Hey Brandon, 1732 just started using Onshape this year and I think it has enabled a lot more kids to be involved in the design process. Anyone that did not have a good enough PC before could not really get involved with the design subteam before. We now have the most amount of students we have ever had on our design subteam (~8) with another group of students on the mechanical and electrical subteams able to review the design and provide feedback or use the model for reference during assembly. These things could be done before but Onshape has made it easier and faster.

The biggest learning curve has been how to manage parts/assemblies (as others have said that is the biggest difference from a more traditional CAD program) and not how to go about designing parts. File management gets harder the more people you have involved (~8 students plus a few mentors all new to Onshape led to some ugly assemblies and parts management) but that can be the case with any CAD program if you don’t have guidelines in place. Onshape has the benefit of having the file management system built in to the program, you just have to learn how to use it. Whereas many “traditional” programs require access to an additional program (which sometimes comes at a cost) though I know many people have had good success with CacheCAD which was new this past year.

Personally I learned ProE/Creo in school and used it at my first two jobs, I learned Inventor for robotics and Solidworks for other purposes. I now use NX at work and Onshape at robotics. I do not think starting off with Onshape will significantly hinder your students ability to learn other programs in the future. The most important thing to learn right now IMO is how to design, how to “think in 3D” as I like to tell my students, the CAD program is just a tool to get there. A number of teams use Onshape in the SE Wisconsin area and I’m sure would be willing to help you out.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T19:34:58.448Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":78.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"wesbass23","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18521,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397763,"name":"Brandon King","username":"kingbrandon14","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingbrandon14/{size}/261181_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T19:47:31.390Z","cooked":"
  • Ease of collaboration is a huge perk for OnShape compared to any other CAD system. Never have to worry about where to store files, how to share them in a timely manner, etc.
  • Ease of getting started for new students/mentors (i.e. no big program installations, availability of great FRC-specific training resources) is super convenient and allows more people to get involved faster.
  • MKCAD library of basically all COTS FRC components, available directly within OnShape!
","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T19:47:31.390Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":110.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"Brandon King","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19708,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2910 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/10","custom_user_title":"2910 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397829,"name":"wesbass23","username":"wesbass23","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T21:42:29.313Z","cooked":"

availability of great FRC-specific training resources) is super convenient and allows more people to get involved faster.

Shout out to @Orion.DeYoe for his training (found here) that we used last fall. (Akash shared this site previously which is full of a lot of useful info).

kingbrandon14:

This one is huge, saved us a ton of time this year.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T21:43:40.338Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":129,"readers_count":128,"score":75.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467501,"topic_slug":"starting-fresh-with-cad","display_username":"wesbass23","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://onshape4frc.com/robochargers-curriculum#week1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC 3005 RoboChargers Onshape CAD Class | Onshape4FRC","clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18521,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/starting-fresh-with-cad/467501/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397921,"name":"Arush Vatul","username":"AVrobocat","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/avrobocat/{size}/212945_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-12T01:56:48.978Z","cooked":"
